subclassFeature.name: Circle of Dreams
entries: Druids who are members of the Circle of Dreams hail from regions that have strong ties to the Feywild and its dreamlike realms. The druids' guardianship of the natural world makes for a natural alliance between them and good-aligned fey. These druids seek to fill the world with dreamy wonder. Their magic mends wounds and brings joy to downcast hearts, and the realms they protect are gleaming, fruitful places, where dream and reality blur together and where the weary can find rest.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: You become able to tap into a portion of the magic of the Feywild, granting you access to certain spells. You learn the {@spell prestidigitation} cantrip.

When you reach certain Druid levels, you gain access to the spells in the table below. They count as Druid spells for you, and you always have them prepared, but they don't count against the total number of spells you prepare each day.

subclassFeature.name: Balm of the Summer Court
entries: You become imbued with the blessings of the Summer Court. You are a font of energy that offers respite from injuries. You have a pool of fey energy represented by a number of {@dice d6}s equal to your druid level.

As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 120 feet of you and spend a number of those dice equal to half your druid level or less. Roll the spent dice and add them together. The target regains a number of hit points equal to the total. The target also gains 1 temporary hit point per die spent.
You regain all expended dice when you finish a long rest, or if you expend a Wild Shape usage as an action.

subclassFeature.name: Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow
entries: Home can be wherever you are, letting you invoke the shadowy power of the Gloaming Court for concealment and shelter. As an action, you can expend a Wild Shape usage to emanate invisible, camouflaging magic in a 30-foot-radius which lasts for 1 hour or until you are incapacitated or die. Total cover blocks the effect.

You and your allies in this space gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and can attempt to {@action Hide} from foes even in plain sight if no movement is spent that turn, magically blending into the environment. Creatures hidden in this way are automatically revealed upon leaving the area. Any light of your choice within this effect isn't visible outside of it.
If used while resting, this magic is centred on a point in space you touch, lasts for the rest's length or until you leave the area, and doesn't require a Wild Shape usage.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Paths
entries: You can use the hidden, magical pathways that some fey use to traverse space in the blink of an eye. As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can also use your action to teleport yourself and a willing creature you touch up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest, or if you expend two Wild Shapes as an action.

subclassFeature.name: Walker in Dreams
entries: The Feywild's magic naturally follows you wherever you go. Once per long rest, you can cast one of your Circle spells without expending a spell slot or using material components, and change its casting time to 1 action.

If you cast {@spell teleportation circle} in this way, you can open a portal to the last location where you finished a long rest on your current plane of existence, rather than opening a portal to a permanent {@spell teleportation circle}.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell dream} at will (with you as the messenger), and it is always prepared for you.
